dependencies? I think it's dependants.
But do we require new build of a dependency when it doesn't require rebuild? Why and in which cases?

replies.bodyText:
Good catch, it should be dependants.
We require a rebuild of dependency if its BC has changed or if dependency's dependency needs rebuild(and so on). How you define which dependencies you are checking relies on IMPLICIT/EXPLICIT parameter.
replies.author: michalovjan

replies.bodyText: Yeah, but you say "A Build has been requested (possibly via dependants)". Do we request dependecies to build even when they don't require rebuild?
replies.author: janinko

replies.bodyText: Yes. If you request a build, it goes through explicit dependencies. The dependency is requested, but it finishes immediately with NO_REBUILD_REQUIRED(REJECTED_ALREADY_BUILT on prod) if its BC was not modified.
replies.author: michalovjan

replies.bodyText: I don't like that behaviour, but fine :)
replies.author: janinko

timeline.bodyText:
I would make it more clear by "(rebuild is required when there is ..."
I think rebuild is required when:

the BC changed
an explicit/implicit (transitive) dependency BC was rebuilt
an explicit/implicit (transitive) dependency BC changed
(if this is not true, do we have good implementation?)

replies.bodyText: Sure I can make it much more clear.
replies.author: michalovjan

replies.bodyText:
Regarding rebuild possibilities, there are three modes:

Explicit

The build config has been modified since the last successful build
A build config, explicitly defined as a dependency of this one, has been modified
since the last successful build
There exists a newer, successful build of a build config explicitly defined as a dependency of this one


Implicit

Explicit criteria plus:
There exists a newer version of an implicit dependency (automatically
captured from sources such as Indy, MRRC or Maven Central)


Force

Always
replies.author: matedo1

replies.bodyText: @matedo1 that's the definition we use in the UI right? Hopefully someone with a better idea of the backend implementation, e.g. Honza or Matej can verify that our description is still accurate.
replies.author: alexcreasy

replies.bodyText: @alexcreasy yes, the definition is coming from the UI
replies.author: matedo1
michalovjan

replies.bodyText:
@michalovjan Martin's paste is a bit innacurate, it is missing the first line:
"Rebuild a previously successful build config when:"
So the bullet points are the minimum criteria which must be met for a rebuild to take place, for each rebuild mode. Your description of "implicit builds" makes no sense in that context, as it's not a criteria that must be met for a rebuild to take place.
If you want to rework the text some more so that your clarification fits in overall, by all means feel free. I don't have a complete understanding of rebuild modes, as they're exclusively backend features, so I'm not the best person to write / critique. Small modifications need to fit the overal context though.
Here's the full text from the UI popup menu, for reference:
Rebuild a previously successful build config when:

**Explicit**
- The build config has been modified since the last successful build
- A build config, explicitly defined as a dependency of this one, has been modified since the last successful build
- There exists a newer, successful build of a build config explicitly defined as a dependency of this one.

**Implicit**
- Explicit criteria plus:
- There exists a newer version of an implicit dependency (automatically captured from sources such as Indy, MRRC or Maven Central)

**Force**
- Always
replies.author: alexcreasy

replies.bodyText: Oh on second reading, I'm wondering if you were just proposing to change the implicit clause rather than add a new one?
replies.author: alexcreasy

replies.bodyText:
Yes, only implicit clause. I thought maybe instead of using parentheses, use further indentation.
Rebuild a previously successful build config when:
Explicit

The build config has been modified since the last successful build
A build config, explicitly defined as a dependency of this one, has been modified since the last successful build
There exists a newer, successful build of a build config explicitly defined as a dependency of this one.

Implicit

Explicit criteria plus:
There exists a newer version of an implicit dependency that can be:
- automatically captured from sources such as Indy, MRRC or Maven Central
- a Build which produced artifacts that were used for alignment during build process

Force

Always
replies.author: michalovjan

replies.bodyText: ^ @alexcreasy @matedo1
replies.author: michalovjan
